intro: Adnaria ursina, commonly known as the sea holly, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and sandy soils, adapting well to saline environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are blue or violet in color. Adnaria ursina is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in coastal gardens.
